reviews.sentence: Three day mini vacation in Seattle. My niece and I stayed for two nights at the Motif and we were thrilled with our choice. The rate was so reasonable that we were not expecting all the luxury we received. A spacious spotless beautiful room with a great view and all necessary amenities. The plate sized rainstorm shower was so enjoyable like a relaxing massage. The beds were extremely comfortable. There were even luxurious robes in the closet. The staff were unfailingly courteous helpful and friendly. All that and a positively unbeatable location important because of our time constraints. The hotel is in the middle of everywhere you want to be in Seattle just blocks from Pike Place Market Westlake Center thus the Monorail to Seattle Center and rail transport to SEATAC Seattle Art Museum great shopping and restaurants and bus stops to further locales like Pioneer Square Capitol Hill etc. It will always be my first choice for stays in Seattle.

Stylish. If you are looking for a cool hotel in downtown Seattle this is a winner. Situated just a few blocks from Pike Market and major stations such as Westlake and Convention Centre it is in an ideal location to explore Seattle. Hotel rooms are spacious and have some great views of Lake Union Puget Sound and the beds are really comfy. The shower was absolutely amazing as others have said. My only complaint would be the drainage. Even just having a light shave it seemed to take an eternity for water to drain and took forever after having a shower for the water to go away. Other than that though I had definitely stay again stylish hotel in downtown Seattle. Also check out the bar on the 5th floor Frolik is very very nice.
Nice hotel close to pikes market and shopping. Awesome staff rooftop bar excellent location and rooms. everyone was very kind and helpful.
In the middle of everything We walked to Pike Market very easily. Close to the Light Rail station. The Frolik restaurant bar was very nice for drinks eats. Our room was comfortable and quiet.

nice location good price but probably will not eat there again. Bar setup was awesome look forward to going back when weather nice and we can have a drink outside. Frolick the bar was awesome but their drinks were so bad we could not drink the first 2 crafted ones we received. They were replaced at no cost but left a bad taste in our mouths. All common areas we are not heated and it was a bit uncomfortable in hallways and common areas almost warmer outside but it would not stop me from going there again.

Cool vibe. Great bar and restaurant. Spent 2 night here on a business trip. Rooms were very nice with Kurig coffee machines free WiFi. Beds were comfortable. The restaurant has a great menu and some really cool drinks. We had dinner once and breakfast here twice. The eggs benedict rocked.

Nice hotel in a great location. Motif Seattle is a solid hotel situated in a great location along Pike street and 5th avenue. Whether coming for business or vacation the location of the hotel is really what stands out. Its located within walking distance to the rail link Pike Place Market and various cafes bars and restaurants. Additionally there is an abundant of shopping high end stores nearby. Check in was very quick and easy and was accompanied by a free glass of wine. The lobby itself is large with plenty of seating. The rooftop bar had a nice relaxed ambiance though the food was only mediocre. I had the pulled pork sliders. I thought it was ok but many in my party thought it was not tasty at all. The rooms were large and comfortable. I would have preferred a king bed over a room with 2 queens but that was strangely more expensive. The internet was blazing fast and the TV had a good selection of channels. My room was promptly cleaned every day with water and toiletries consistently being replaced. There really is n’t anything I can complain about. I enjoyed my stay at Motif Seattle and would recommend it. I gave it a 4 out of 5 rating because though I enjoyed my stay it did n’t have that WOW factor which I require to give a 5 star review.

Weekend stay. I really enjoyed staying at Motif. The rooms were great they are pet friendly and the location is pretty central to downtown shopping and the waterfront. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. There was complimentary wine tasting in the evening while we were there. We also had a catered happy hour event for our group and the appetizers were really good. There is a bar and restaurant on the fifth floor. We had dinner there one night. I would say it is just okay. There are so many really great restaurants in Seattle that it really only makes sense to eat there if you just do not feel like going out. If you eat too much there is also a nice fitness room. You can take the Monorail to Seattle Center or just walk down to the waterfront. Lots of shopping nearby.

Good place to stay. The Motif is a good option for a short stay in Seattle. The location is excellent being right in the heart of Downtown. It ’s only a 3 min walk from Westlake Station where you can use the Light Link Rail as cheap convenient transport to and from SeaTac Airport. The rooms feature a fridge safe HD TV and free Wi Fi but are gloomily lit with the customary shortage of coat hangers. The bathrooms have a good shower but there ’s a lack of hooks and rails and an impractical sliding door. A reasonably priced breakfast is available across the road at Speciality ’s Café Bakery.

Motif Seattle great stay great value. We just got back from Seattle where we stayed at the Motif Hotel. The hotel is very modern and very clean we were on the 9th floor and had a view of the ocean. The rooms were extremely clean and the beds were the best I have ever slept on. Great water pressure in the shower and nice selection of toiletries. Room came with free coffee and bottled water. Reception was fast and friendly and we were given umbrellas by the door man due to the weather. Hot cider available in the lobby the hotel has a nice sitting area outside the lobby with a fireplace and on the fifth floor there is an outdoor patio with fireplace. Overall this is a great location and a great hotel. I highly recommend it. Everything Central location shopping food and markets very close Everything was great.

Road Trip to West Coast. Nice big clean room with a view of the sea. Plenty of towels in a nice bathroom. Plenty of hot water and shampoo soap. Check in was quick with pleasant reception staff. Nice quite night with a comfortable bed. Did not eat at the Hotel went to convenient dinner opposite the hotel.
Exceptional. Very good location. Cleaned romKind stafsWelcoming wineGod view in the room. No swimming pool No breakfast This is my kidss opinion.

Great location wonderful for groupsQ. The hotel was very accommodating for our large group and we had zero issues. Lots of places to meet on the rooftop cafe downstairs restaurant has a great pool room to have drinks play pool and not be in a loud room so we could actually talk with each other and not shout.

I booked this hotel quickly and at the last minute when my travel plans changed and could not have made a better choice. The hotel is chic modern and elegant and the location is excellent. The cost is half of that charged by luxury hotels in the same area of Seattle. It is a block away from the monorail to the Seattle Center a five minute walk from Pike ’s Market and ten minutes from the waterfront. The staff were all very pleasant. My only complaint is that the restaurant on the 5th floor automatically added a 20 percent tip for mediocre serve. But when I go back to Seattle I will return to the Motif.

Okay. We arrived late and there was no food or drink available in the hotel or nearby other than a few packaged snacks in the lobby. And there was no one to help. Alexa did not work and no one answered the phone or text messages. We went to bed hungry and thirsty. Rooms were small pretty clean but not what was expected for the money.

Good location. Stayed at Motif for a business trip and did n’t realize how close it was to Pike Market. It was also a short walk from an Alamo Enterprise rental car drop off spot. Since parking would have been around 45 a day it was better for me to not have a car. The room was nicely equipped. The bathroom had a hair dryer soap shampoo conditioner and lotion. The bed was comfortable. The room was quiet. The coffee maker Keurig was hard to fill with the room mugs. I did not try the on property restaurant but there is one. I ’d return if I had more business in the area.

The staff was amazing. From being greeted with a glass of wine which is complimentary from 1 8 to the staff at their restaurant. I did n’t like how the ice machines were only on even floors or that their vending machine was not cash or card it was some odd ap on your phone. The bed was n’t comfortable it was pretty hard and made for a sleepless night even after a night out of drinking. Overall though I did enjoy my stay.

it is Ok. Motif Seattle recently joined the World of Hyat brand so I thought I had check it out. Motif Seattle has on sight parking no valet. Room 913 was very spacious and could accommodate a family of 4 easily. Motif Seattle offers wine tasting from 1 PM to 8 PM nightly. it is a short walk from Motif Seattle to the Light Rail if you want to go to a game. But everything around you will be closed by midnight and room service ends at 10 PM 10 PM. If you make it back in time to order room service the menu is somewhere on your TV. Frolic on sight lounge closes at 12 AM … avoid using the elevator when it closes elevator use becomes much more complicated after 1 PM wine tasting that evolves into a Frolicking bar Closing Time. The bed sheets were clean. The bed I chose to sleep on in room 913 there are two beds had a gravitational pull to its center. The bathtub looked old because it was small like really small 1930s small but when I stepped in it it felt like the bottom flexed under my weight definitely a new material and very small. The towels were scratchy. Petes coffee is directly across the street. It appears to be frequented by travelers and by those who like to leave religious literature for travelers. Leaving the parking garage was delayed the card reader or perhaps the card was not prompting the gate to open … had to push a button that was covered with black electrical tape I am not sure the bottom did anything but fortunately as if by divine intervention or perhaps because I Snatched up gods calling card at Petes Coffee. the gate eventually allowed us to leave. The decor was pleasant. The walk to Pike Place Market is doable but I like Grand Hyats location better.

From the minute we walked in the door our concierge Gene was very welcoming and very cordial. He got us checked in and gave us information about the restaurants in the hotel and other places we might be interested in. Then we went to our room which was clean and very comfortable. Wish we could have stayed longer but our stay was excellent. Will stay again next visit.

Great place to stay in Seattle. I was in Seattle for work and my company put me up in the Motif. It is a beautiful property really close to my office. The staff there was really nice and helpful. The GM greeted me and even had his business trips manager send up a bottle of wine and a cheese plate. I thought that was really thoughtful. Being in town all alone and to be surprised with a cheese plate and a nice bottle of wine was a great touch. The concierge Gene was also very helpful. He recommended many different places to me while I was in town and they were all pretty good. It was the beginning of museum month in Seattle and he made sure as soon as February started that I was aware and knew how to take advantage of the discount. My room was incredible. The view was awesome. The bathroom had a really cool shower that even had a bench to sit downI can not say enough nice things about my stay at their hotel. I definitely recommend anyone spending time in Seattle to stay at the Motif.
